name: Dummies Baseball #24 Quiz / Test | MLB for Dummies | 10 Questions

questions.text: What does the term 'cellar' refer to?
questions.correct: A team that is in last place
options: The bottom of the line-up
The pitcher on the team with the worst pitching record
The dugout, because it is lower than the playing field
questions.explanation:
A team that is in last place.

	A team that is in the 'cellar', is not having a good time, and usually has the worst record in the division.  In 2002, the Tigers and Tampa Bay finished in the cellar for the season.

options: Hall of Fame Runner-up
Hard Righthander
Hitter, then pinch runner
questions.explanation:
Home Run.

	'HR' is the scoring term for home run.  When a batter hits a home run, this is how it is entered in the official scorebook.  Only 2 players in the 20th century hit 700 HRs.  They were Babe Ruth and Hank Aaron.

questions.correct: A pitch that almost hits the batter
options: The song that is sung during the 7th inning stretch
The singing of the Star Spangled Banner
When a runner slides head-first into a base
questions.explanation:
A pitch that almost hits the batter.

	Chin Music is used more and more as time goes on.  Umpires have been trained to deal with this issue, and a pitcher may be ejected after a warning of a Chin Music pitch.  Chin music is used normally to set up a batter with an inside pitch, and then throw a pitch on the outside corner of the plate.

questions.text: The term 'the gap' refers to what?
options: The distance between home plate and the batter
The distance between the outfield fence and the warning track
The area between the infield grass and the outfield grass
questions.explanation:
The space between positioned outfielders.

	Also known as 'the alley', the gap is where hitters attempt to hit the ball into the outfield, where there are no outfielders present.  Usually the ball rolls to the fence, and extra bases are made.

options: A broken bat
A bunt that rolls foul
A player who was just ejected from the game
questions.explanation:
A pitch.

	The infamous spit ball!  Gaylord Perry was the master in throwing the spitter.

questions.correct: When a runner is caught in a rundown
options: When a player is chewing tobacco
When a player is ejected from the game
A type of pitch
questions.explanation:
When a runner is caught in a rundown.

	A pickle occurs when a runner is caught between bases, and is in a rundown.  The runner goes back and forth, back and forth, watching the fielders throwing to each other, in an attempt to tag the runner out.

questions.text: What happened when a player had been 'whiffed'?
options: He was replaced by a relief pitcher
He had the wind knocked out of him
His hit was carried out of the ballpark by the wind
questions.explanation:
He struck out.

	This is a term that occurs when a batter has struck out.  It has also been referred to as a 'K'.  Bobby Bonds was whiffed 189 times in a season, setting a 20th century record.

options: A player lost a shoe
When a player has a multiple game hitting streak
The game was played in over 100 degree temperature
questions.explanation:
Home run.

	Mark McGwire hit 70 taters in 1999, and Barry Bonds hit 73 in 2001.

questions.correct: A small ballpark that favors the hitters
options: The bullpen
The batters box
The on-deck circle
questions.explanation:
A small ballpark that favors the hitters.

	In early baseball there were many bandboxes.  Major League baseball stepped in and regulated the minimum outfield fence measurements, to avoid some teams from having the advantage throughout most of their season.

options: A bunted ball that goes foul
The team with the purple jerseys
When a team has used 5 relief pitchers
questions.explanation:
A fight between multiple players.

	A rhubarb is not for the family upbringing.  A scuffle is when two players have differences, but a rhubarb is when both benches unload, fight each other, and then the Commissioner levies multiple fines and suspensions.  For some reason, the media promotes the replays of these incidents.
